title: Hey Riot! The direction of Mordekaiser!
body:
Well first off a big "thank you" coming from my cold metal Hueart.
The current PBE cycle's the first glimmer of hope for Mordekaiser on the gameplay front and I'd like to seize this opportunity to get down to business and contemplate on which direction Mordekaiser should be guided towards.

To do this I'll just present some of my ideas on how to tweak his current kit and offer my insight on why I think they should be considered.
Still, I'm no gameplay expert by any means but a Metal-maniac, soon...

**IRON MAN**
Real talk? I hated the change putting his shield gen from 35% down to 25% but with the changes to his Siphon I'm actually quite happy with his passive.
Nothin' worth changing here except maybe not making it decay during combat but decay at a higher rate outside of it (2% base health perhaps?)

**Mace of Spades**
Let's be honest. His third Q is satisfying but that's about it. It lacks counterplay if he flashes on top of you and it takes up way too much of his damage budget.

I like the direction of his Q proposed on the PBE but rather than making his third Q hold most of his damage I'd like to propose the following;

->Mace of Spades empowers Mordekaiser's next three basic attacks, adding a magic damage component.
->No longer doubles the third strike's damage.
->Each of the three hits deal 100+110%AD+80%AP for a total of; 300+330%AD+240% AP.
The damage is even lower than the current PBE one but it gives him consistent Damage on each hit. No more insta bursting!
Yet, for Morde to remain a threat beyond his third Q he has to be able to put out constant damage so how about we borrow from Hecarim's Q and add a stacking buff towards Morde's Q, reducing his Mace of Spades' cool down by 1-2 depending on the stacks he gathered.
This would make him a threat in prolonged fights since he'd be smacking his enemies 24/7 with his mace of spades.
The stacks would also increase his health costs to even things out a bit.

This change would make him less oppressive with his third Q and give him ways to continue building up shield and dish out damage once he's in the fray.

**Harvester of Sorrow**
Welp, Solo casting for the DoT would be nice. Period.

I'd even go as far as to suggest the removal of the heal in favor of a bit more UMF for his W :9

**Siphon of Destruction**
I'm pretty satisfied with this one actually.
It was overbearing pre-rework due to its high base damage and spammability.
It now functions as Mordekaiser's Shield Generator tool, making it his bread and butter ability  for fighting his foes.

**Children of the Grave**
As much as I miss the old range (850 range ftw!) Morde should be kept as a close-range damage threat rather than a long range nuker.

**Base stats!:**
Mordekaiser's base stats are something worth looking at, being really low and not exactly helping him get the job done.

Movement Speed; Buffing his MS up to 335 would be only fair after the nerfs to Trinity force and reducing his attack range to 175. Besides, he's the only juggernaut without any Mobility/CC and most of his hombres got MS upwards to 345.

Attack Speed; His AS being low was a great way to ensure he wouldn't just smack his enemies with his third Q too quickly.
But with the proposed changes one could consider buffing his AS per level to make him able to get off his Q's more often in the late game where every second counts.

Base Armor; 20 base armor... Ehh.... He might need a tad more armor but I'd actually be fine with his armor per level being beefed up instead.

Base Health; 525+73/level. Maxing out at 1765. Really, really, really low for a Juggernaut. Especially compared to Darius, Illai and Gren all of which have over 2100.
->Health per level 73->83. This would make him max out at 1900ish without buffing his early all that much.

I hope you've noticed a pattern here;
Morde should scale a lot better with levels to become this Lategame Monster and to make use of his *shudders* W passive.
Not only this but his beefed up base stats would help him survive longer in fights and get his Q's off.
With my proposed Q changes he'd need to stick around to deal his damage so these changes should be reasonable.


**Riot's Agenda?**
Meddler once mentioned they wanted Morde to become more of a consistent damage bruiser that just refused to die with his Iron Man passive and less of a burst champion that completely obliterates you in the fragment of a second. 
With his Q being similar to hecarim's he'd be able to put out great sustained damage, filling his shield 24/7 and get rewarded for STAYING in melee range to destroy the opposition rather than just getting ONE empowered Q off to completely vaporize the unlucky enemy.

Still, this is only my opinion. We all have different visions of the Master of Metal, The IRON REVENANT.
Still, the fact that there are Mordekaiser changes on the PBE pleases me greatly and I'm anxious to know Riot's plans regarding Mordekaiser and how he'll finally become a healthy addition to the game, making most Morde fans happy :)

~M.M

Why get a gunblade? He's pure AoE and his Q is counted as an AoE for the sake of Vamp.

There are several reasons for including. Gunblade;

-Morde scales extremely well with AD and AP
-it provides a ranged point and click slow with decent base damage and ratio as well as only having 30 second downtime
-its build path is great and its cost was kept the same in the preseason
-the pseudo spellvamp synergises with grasp of tge undying and Spirit Visage
-it provides a very strong mid game power spike

-Nostalgia factor's a reason to pick it up as well. For me at least

I'm trying to play Morde Top but I am in some real troubles, I've faced a Darius and a Olaf for now.

Basically I can afford trades at level 3 and even get an early kill if I'm lucky enough just to be totally destroyed as he gets the first item because of their damage being abnormously more than mine plus my defenses being useless. I t feels like any other toplaner can do everything better than me.

Honestly, I would even accept not giving his W solo strength if they just raised his base stats so he can actually take a hit in a solo lane. It seems like any champion with 325 ms just can't survive by themselves, and {{champion:82}} 's one of the biggest pushers in the game. Even when I do ward, consistently, it's a crap shoot whether I'll live since I'm just so damn slow.

I think the reason his base stats, including per level, are so low is because he'll always be a higher level than his lane opponents. Acting as a designer, here's what I would experiment with on Morde. Thoughts?

I believe Morde can be strong in a duo lane because he as a kit that works well in one, not because he out-levels the enemy lane. (I think your experience backs this up as well. "Don't need adc. Morde steal adc.")


1. Harvester of Sorrow:
  - Remove bonus XP
  - Nerf the Damage to ~2/3
  - Damage while not overlapping returns, including self-cast.
  - When overlapping, both zones deal damage (4/3x live damage)

2. Children of the Grave: since Morde is losing a lot of burst, his R needs a different purpose from "I'm bursting you now, mkay?" With this change, casting your ult on an enemy means, "I'm coming for YOU, and I don't care what gets in my way!"
  - When moving towards a cursed enemy, Morde gains 50 bonus MS.
  - When moving away from Morde, cursed enemies are slowed by 50 MS.
  - When there is a cursed enemy within 1500 units, Morde gains 30% slow resist and tenacity.

The Gimmicks are being buffed.
http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-qLdI7hPTs7w/VkZ8O6jGLfI/AAAAAAAA0lE/JhNRsc9MZe0/s640/Eee.jpg
E now scales from 15%-24% instant shield at level 5.

I love that he can get his shield on, but this is just the wrong way of doing it.

I agree about his shield dealing damage over time, something that shouldn't have been removed to keep top lane viable. 
However I'd rather have his old mace of spades back; the boosted damage against someone trying to solo you was a nice unexpected buff, while the splash damage allowed him to farm despite being bullied by more dangerous top laners (riven, gnar, ext). 
But I still agree he needs his base stats buffed, they wanted him to be a juggernaut then turned around and made him out of tinfoil.

>Morde should scale a lot better with levels to become this Lategame Monster 

 Not sure if they should focus on making him a lategame monster. I play only duo lane Morde and the niche of duo lane Morde is to end the game before the ADC outscales you. The PBE changes taking a bit of his early laning power and making him a bit stronger in lategame. While not enough to change his identity, i would prefer them to stop following the same approach cuz elsewise there would be no reason to pick him over the ADCs

 Ofc i dont play solo lane Morde so its expected that the interests are somewhat conflicted.
